title: Europe’s Leaders Headed Off Giveaway to Putin, but Emerged Without a Clear Path
summary: The leaders dropped everything to travel to Washington to ensure President Trump didn’t force a bad deal on Ukraine.  A road map for peace remains elusive.

title: Securing Postwar Ukraine, Even With Trump’s Pledge to Help, Is Complex
summary: Russia seems unlikely to agree to Western troops in Ukraine as part of any deal to end the war.

title: 5 Takeaways From Trump’s Meeting With Zelensky and European Leaders
summary: The leaders presented a relatively united front and appeared to agree on the next steps in the effort to halt the fighting between Ukraine and Russia. But much remained unresolved.

title: Zelensky’s Charm Offensive, and Israel’s Push to Send Gazans to South Sudan
summary: Plus, the rise of rap on tour.

title: In Pursuing Trump Rival, Weaponization Czar Sidesteps Justice Dept. Norms
summary: Edward R. Martin Jr.’s conduct is part of a pattern in which top administration officials try to use the vast powers of the government to cast the specter of criminality on President Trump’s enemies.

title: Trump Administration Discusses Taking 10% Stake in Intel
summary: Federal officials are considering the move because Intel, the last leading-edge chipmaker in the United States, has been struggling.

title: The Politics of Crime Are Perilous for Left and Right Alike
summary: President Trump has latched on to concerns about crime, as liberals point to its decline. The politics often flip when it comes to mass shootings.

title: The Fight With Democrats That Trump Wants Now
summary: Crime is tricky territory for Democrats and President Trump knows it.

title: Why Did Shari Redstone Give Up Control of Paramount?
summary: The media mogul spoke at length for the first time about selling her family’s empire, Paramount’s settlement with President Trump — and getting her reputation battered along the way.

title: The Race to Rescue PBS and NPR Stations
summary: The Knight Foundation and other top organizations are aiming to provide $50 million to stabilize the stations most at risk from the recent federal government funding cuts.

title: MSNBC’s Rebrand to MS NOW Invites Bemusement and Ridicule
summary: The cable TV network’s new name, MS NOW, became the subject of mockery soon after it was announced on Monday.

title: An Evening With the Central Park Coyotes
summary: Romeo and Juliet are shy and graceful, leaping over fences, hunting for rodents and catching at least one Canada goose.

title: Air Canada and Striking Flight Attendants’ Union Reach Tentative Deal
summary: Thousands of flight attendants must still approve the agreement. The walkout, which began Saturday, has disrupted half a million travelers’ plans, the airline said.

title: Economic Data Has Taken a Dark Turn. That Doesn’t Mean a Crash Is Near.
summary: Inflation is up and job creation down, but the U.S. economy could still pull through without too much pain.

title: Hurricane Erin Brings Rip Currents Closing Jersey Shore and Rehoboth Beaches
summary: Several beaches in New Jersey and Delaware were closed as the powerful storm churned in the Atlantic. Rip currents have been blamed for at least one death.

title: Rip Current Survival Tips: What to Do if You Get Caught in One
summary: From land, a rip current can appear relatively calm, as a strip of water that extends out between breaking waves. Its appearance can be deceiving.

title: Majora’s Mask Had No Minor Characters
summary: The sixth Legend of Zelda entry took narrative storytelling in video games to new heights by packing side quests with emotional depth.

summary: And while we’re at it, let’s think about the phrase “land swap.”

title: Netanyahu Faces Pressure From Far Right Over New Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Proposal
summary: Some members of Israel’s coalition have ruled out a proposed hostage deal with Hamas, but the prime minister has yet to state his position.

title: Cases of Mosquito-Borne Chikungunya Virus Are Surging Globally: What to Know
summary: Chikungunya, which can disable victims for years, is spreading rapidly, including in China and other places that have not seen it before.

title: In Maine, a Political Novice Makes a Long-Shot Bid to Oust Collins
summary: Democrats hope to recruit Governor Janet Mills to challenge the powerful Republican senator, but an oyster farmer with a working man’s pitch thinks he has a better chance.

title: Vietnamese Are Helping Cuba With 38-Cent Donations. A Lot of Them.
summary: Cuba sent doctors and food to Vietnam during the war. Now ordinary Vietnamese are sending cash to struggling Cubans.
